alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 13 at 3:29PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall remains a possibility. * WHERE...Guam. Rota, Saipan and Tinian. * WHEN...Through 6 AM ChST Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Flash flooding may occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy showers and thunderstorms associated with Tropical Depression 21W embedded within the monsoon trough east of the Marianas and a tropical disturbance northwest. Model trends indicate rainfall amounts between 2 and 4 inches with locally heavier amounts in excess of 6 inches possible through late Saturday night. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. If living near streams and rivers, prepare to move items away from stream and river banks. Make sure storm drains nearby are not clogged, especially in low-lying areas.
